item.title: Image classification using CNNs
item.description: In this first project, I want to explore image classification using Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs). CNNs are a type of neural network that has been proven to work well with image data since they account for the fact that adjacent pixels share similar properties and allows the image to be downsampled without losing valuable information. This approach was first presented by Yann LeCun et al (1998) using LeNet-5 to classify handwritten digits.

item.title: About
item.description: About Data Scientist/ Product Analyst at Google based in the Bay Area. I enable teams to build better products by uncovering data-driven insights to guide product decisions such as understanding how our products are being used and how product changes impact user behaviour. I am experienced in SQL, Python, Machine Learning libraries as well as building data infrastructure, dashboards, and metrics. My previous work experience includes business intelligence/ data warehousing, digital marketing analytics and investment banking.
